newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's Transaero launches new regular flights.
newsitem.headline: Russia's Transaero launches new regular flights.

text.p: Private Russian carrier Transaero said on Monday that it would begin regular flights this month from Moscow to Akmola, the planned new capital of Kazakhstan, and to the central Russian city of Samara.
Company spokeswoman Natalya Alexashina told Reuters that weekly Sunday flights between Moscow and Akmola would start on October 27.
"The company will operate Boeing 757 passenger aircraft with two classes of service," she said.
The Kazakh government plans to move 1,200 km (745 miles) northwest from Almaty to the dilapidated steppe town of Akmola by the end of the decade.
From October 28, Transaero also will launch Moscow-Samara route, operating Boeing 737s five times a week.
The airline flies to 21 destinations in the former Soviet Union and six other international destinations.
